description: Use this action to retrieve a specific snapshot record.

parameters.name: Catalog
parameters.description: Specifies the catalog related to the request. Valid values are: AWS: Retrieves the snapshot from the production AWS environment. Sandbox: Retrieves the snapshot from a sandbox environment used for testing or development purposes.

parameters.name: EngagementIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the engagement associated with the snapshot. This field links the snapshot to a specific engagement context.

parameters.name: ResourceIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the specific resource that was snapshotted. The format and constraints of this identifier depend on the ResourceType specified. For Opportunity type, it will be an opportunity ID.

parameters.name: ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier
parameters.description: he name of the template that defines the schema for the snapshot. This template determines which subset of the resource data is included in the snapshot and must correspond to an existing and valid template for the specified ResourceType.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of resource that was snapshotted. This field determines the structure and content of the snapshot payload. Valid value includes: Opportunity: For opportunity-related data.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the resource snapshot.

nested_items.name: Catalog
nested_items.description: The catalog in which the snapshot was created. Matches the Catalog specified in the request.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the snapshot was created, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-06-01T14:30:00Z'). This allows for precise tracking of when the snapshot was taken.

nested_items.name: CreatedBy
nested_items.description: The AWS account ID of the principal (user or role) who created the snapshot. This helps in tracking the origin of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: EngagementId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the engagement associated with this snapshot. Matches the EngagementIdentifier specified in the request.

nested_items.name: OpportunitySummary
nested_items.description: An object that contains an opportunity's subset of fields.

nested_items.name: City
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's city associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: CountryCode
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's country associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: PostalCode
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's postal code associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: StateOrRegion
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's state or region associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: StreetAddress
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's street address associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: AwsAccountId
nested_items.description: Specifies the Customer Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: CompanyName
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's company name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: Duns
nested_items.description: Indicates the Customer DUNS number, if available.

nested_items.name: Industry
nested_items.description: Specifies the industry the end Customer belongs to that's associated with the Opportunity. It refers to the category or sector where the customer's business operates. This is a required field.

nested_items.name: OtherIndustry
nested_items.description: Specifies the end Customer's industry associated with the Opportunity, when the selected value in the Industry field is Other.

nested_items.name: WebsiteUrl
nested_items.description: Specifies the end customer's company website URL associated with the Opportunity. This value is crucial to map the customer within the Amazon Web Services CRM system. This field is required in all cases except when the opportunity is related to national security.

nested_items.name: Contacts
nested_items.description: Represents the contact details for individuals associated with the customer of the Opportunity. This field captures relevant contacts, including decision-makers, influencers, and technical stakeholders within the customer organization. These contacts are key to progressing the opportunity.

nested_items.name: BusinessTitle
nested_items.description: The partner contact's title (job title or role) associated with the Opportunity. BusinessTitle supports either PartnerAccountManager or OpportunityOwner.

nested_items.name: Email
nested_items.description: The contact's email address associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: FirstName
nested_items.description: The contact's first name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: LastName
nested_items.description: The contact's last name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: Phone
nested_items.description: The contact's phone number associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: Lifecycle
nested_items.description: Contains information about the opportunity's lifecycle, including its current stage, status, and important dates such as creation and last modification times.

nested_items.name: NextSteps
nested_items.description: Describes the next steps for the opportunity shared through a snapshot.

nested_items.name: ReviewStatus
nested_items.description: Defines the approval status of the opportunity shared through a snapshot.

nested_items.name: Stage
nested_items.description: Defines the current stage of the opportunity shared through a snapshot.

nested_items.name: TargetCloseDate
nested_items.description: The projected launch date of the opportunity shared through a snapshot.

nested_items.name: OpportunityTeam
nested_items.description: Represents the internal team handling the opportunity. Specify the members involved in collaborating on an opportunity within the partner's organization.

nested_items.name: BusinessTitle
nested_items.description: The partner contact's title (job title or role) associated with the Opportunity. BusinessTitle supports either PartnerAccountManager or OpportunityOwner.

nested_items.name: Email
nested_items.description: The contact's email address associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: FirstName
nested_items.description: The contact's first name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: LastName
nested_items.description: The contact's last name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: Phone
nested_items.description: The contact's phone number associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: OpportunityType
nested_items.description: Specifies the opportunity type.

nested_items.name: PrimaryNeedsFromAws
nested_items.description: Identifies the type of support the partner needs from AWS.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CustomerUseCase
nested_items.description: Specifies the proposed solution focus or type of workload for the project.

nested_items.name: DeliveryModels
nested_items.description: Describes the deployment or consumption model for the partner solution or offering. This field indicates how the project's solution will be delivered or implemented for the customer.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExpectedCustomerSpend
nested_items.description: Provides information about the anticipated customer spend related to this project. This may include details such as amount, frequency, and currency of expected expenditure.

nested_items.name: Amount
nested_items.description: Represents the estimated monthly revenue that the partner expects to earn from the opportunity. This helps in forecasting financial returns.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: Indicates the currency in which the revenue estimate is provided. This helps in understanding the financial impact across different markets.

nested_items.name: EstimationUrl
nested_items.description: A URL providing additional information or context about the spend estimation.

nested_items.name: Frequency
nested_items.description: Indicates how frequently the customer is expected to spend the projected amount. This can include values such as Monthly, Quarterly, or Annually. The default value is Monthly, representing recurring monthly spend.

nested_items.name: TargetCompany
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the partner company that is expected to generate revenue from the opportunity. This field helps track the partner's involvement in the opportunity.

nested_items.name: OtherSolutionDescription
nested_items.description: Offers a description of other solutions if the standard solutions do not adequately cover the project's scope.

nested_items.name: SalesActivities
nested_items.description: Lists the pre-sales activities that have occurred with the end-customer related to the opportunity. This field is conditionally mandatory when the project is qualified for Co-Sell and helps drive assignment priority on the AWS side. It provides insight into the engagement level with the customer.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RelatedEntityIdentifiers
nested_items.description: This field provides the associations' information for other entities with the opportunity. These entities include identifiers for AWSProducts, Partner Solutions, and AWSMarketplaceOffers.

nested_items.name: AwsMarketplaceOffers
nested_items.description: Takes one value per opportunity. Each value is an Amazon Resource Name (ARN), in this format: "offers": ["arn:aws:aws-marketplace:us-east-1:999999999999:AWSMarketplace/Offer/offer-sampleOffer32"].
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AwsProducts
nested_items.description: Enables the association of specific Amazon Web Services products with the Opportunity. Partners can indicate the relevant Amazon Web Services products for the Opportunity's solution and align with the customer's needs. Returns multiple values separated by commas. For example, "AWSProducts" : ["AmazonRedshift", "AWSAppFabric", "AWSCleanRooms"].
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Solutions
nested_items.description: Enables partner solutions or offerings' association with an opportunity. To associate a solution, provide the solution's unique identifier, which you can obtain with the ListSolutions operation.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the specific resource that was snapshotted. Matches the ResourceIdentifier specified in the request.

nested_items.name: ResourceSnapshotTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the view used for this snapshot. This is the same as the template name.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The type of the resource that was snapshotted. Matches the ResourceType specified in the request.

nested_items.name: Revision
nested_items.description: The revision number of this snapshot. This is a positive integer that is sequential and unique within the context of a resource view.
